intro: Lepidium armoracium var. intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate peppergrass, is a flowering plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is native to the western United States and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are alternate, linear to lanceolate, and covered in fine pubescence. This variety is considered a subspecies of Lepidium armoracium and exhibits intermediate features between the typical and other varieties of the species.
